info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 22 at 2:25PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Catawba, eastern Lincoln, southern Iredell, northwestern Mecklenburg, southeastern Cleveland, western Rowan, Gaston, north central York and northeastern Cherokee Counties through 315 PM EDT... At 225 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles southwest of Statesville to near Lincolnton to 5 miles north of Gaffney. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea to dime size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Gastonia, Lincolnton, Shelby, Huntersville, Statesville, Cornelius, Mooresville, Kings Mountain, Mt Holly and Davidson. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
